verses.roman:
yatheṣṭa vihari' kṛṣṇa kare antardhāna
antardhāna kari' mane kare anumāna

synonyms: yathā-iṣṭa—as much as He wishes; vihari'-enjoying; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa; kare—makes; antardhāna—disappearance; antardhāna kari'-disappearing; mane—in the mind; kare—He makes; anumāna—consideration.
translation: Lord Kṛṣṇa enjoys His transcendental pastimes as long as He wishes, and then He disappears. After disappearing, however, He thinks thus:
